comments:
I have Fedora Core 4 x86_64. My PC is Athlon AMD64 3000 with 1 Gb RAM.
There is a version of Eclipse included in my distribution. 

Eclipse Platform
Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050401-1645

I tried to use it but I  produces serveral errors.
The third menu says: "%Refactoring.menu.label"
I start a new Java project Clase1, it creates de folder but says "An error
ocurred while creating the Java Project. Reason: problems encountered while
setting project description."
When I try to add a new class no code is generated, only a file .java in blank.
I make a class HolaMundo within Clase1 public and public static void main
option. It says "Creation of element failed. SAX parse error: reference to
undeclared entity: It".

I have installed all Java components of my distribution who includes JRE.

My Configuration Details from About option.

*******************************************************************************

Thus I have uninstalled this version and I have downloaded eclipse
SDK-3.1-linux-gtk-x86-64 from your site.
But it is worse. I decompress the file in /home/pablo.
Then enter into eclipse and I execute ./eclipse
The application starts, but then hangs up. So I have to restart my computer.
Next execution does not start and there is a log file in org.eclipse.platform_3.1.0.

What should I do?

Thanks in advance from Argentina.

!SESSION 2005-07-23 16:27:54.425 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.fullversion=GNU libgcj 4.0.0 20050519 (Red Hat 4.0.0-8)
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86_64, WS=gtk, NL=es_ES

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-07-23 16:27:55.633
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1

   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(java.lang.Object)
(Unknown Source)
   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(java.lang.String[],

java.net.URL[]) (Unknown Source)

   at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(java.lang.String[]) (Unknown Source)

   at .__libc_start_main (/lib64/libc-2.3.5.so)

Eclipse is not supported on gcj (some Linux distros have it working). 
On Linux, we test on Sun and IBM VMs. The 3.1 drop downloaded from eclipse.org
(or a mirror) should work with any recent 1.4/1.5 Sun/IBM VMs. 

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 35995 ***

(In reply to comment #1)
> Eclipse is not supported on gcj (some Linux distros have it working). 
> On Linux, we test on Sun and IBM VMs. The 3.1 drop downloaded from eclipse.org
> (or a mirror) should work with any recent 1.4/1.5 Sun/IBM VMs. 
> *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 35995 ***

Rafael:

Do you speak Spanish?
I can't understand why Fedora Core 4 x86_64 include in the distro Java and 
Eclipse and it does not work... 
Anyway , can you tell me what should I download to run Eclipse 3.1 successfully 
in my plataform?
I search in http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/download.html
for J2SE v 1.4.2_08  SDK  
But I can not see a version for Athlon AMD64.

Thanks.

> Do you speak Spanish?

Nope, Brazilian Portuguese. :)

>I can't understand why Fedora Core 4 x86_64 include in the distro Java 
>and Eclipse and it does not work... 

Sorry, but I cannot answer about problems with running on GCJ - you should try
the Fedora user/support forums instead.

> Anyway , can you tell me what should I download to

> for J2SE v 1.4.2_08  SDK

It seems Sun does not support AMD64 in 1.4, but they do in 5.0 (a.k.a. 1.5).
I have downloaded eclipse 3.1 x86_64 and jdk1.5.0_04 64 bits and it works.
